lead_paragraph: Providence hired Drake’s Keno Davis as its new coach, less than two weeks after he was named the Associated Press national coach of the year. In his first season as a head coach, he took Drake to its first N.C.A.A. tournament since 1971, and led it to a school-best 28-5 record and its first national ranking in 33 years. He replaces Tim Welsh, who was fired last month.
